attributes.action: Defend Traditional and Customary land Ownership in Uganda
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ugandans are concerned at the increasing manipulation of land law by President Museveni, thinly disguised as Land Reform. The controversial Land Act 1998  has significantly devalued land. The Land Bill is potentially devastating for the poor whose only valuable possession is inherited land.  It   
i) 	undermines centuries old customary land tenure systems 
ii) 	diminishes powers of traditional leaders from presiding over local land disputes 
iii) 	attempts to centralise traditional land rights

Land Reform is designed to advantage two groups: 

1.	Ethnic Bahima to the detriment of traditional agricultural communities   

2.	Museveni’s unethical land confiscations for ‘Investors’ who should negotiate directly with land owners. 

Growing anger and resentment results in warning signs mirroring the UN Eight Stages of Genocide. 

This petition seeks:
i.	Intervention to avert ethnic conflict over controversial land reform and land confiscations, including 9000 square miles, subject of British Buganda Agreement of 1900.

ii.	Advocacy for the land rights of ancient communities, against the  excesses of opportunistic politicians

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
